name: expert-sql
description: SQL query generation expert focado em respostas consistentes e curtas. Treinado em 147.140 exemplos validados de múltiplas fontes. Esta versão (0.3.0) utiliza o checkpoint-500 — avaliado com 100% de SQL válido em 15 cenários de teste e melhorias em consultas JOIN/HAVING em comparação ao pacote v0.2.1.
author: hivellm

rope_scaling._comment: Qwen3-specific NTK-by-parts scaling (β=0.25). Matches Rust implementation (qwen3_model.rs:49-57)

adapters._comment: Checkpoint-500 (epoch 0.5): Melhor equilíbrio entre completude e concisão. 100% das saídas válidas em 15 testes comparativos e melhores respostas em JOIN/HAVING versus v0.2.1.

limitations.description: Recursive CTEs (WITH RECURSIVE) remain unreliable - rewrites into self-joins or subqueries instead of proper recursion
limitations.example: Query: 'Find all ancestors' → Generates self-joins instead of WITH RECURSIVE
limitations.workaround: Use iterative queries or provide explicit depth limit in prompt

limitations.description: UNION / UNION ALL generates redundant predicates or swaps to JOIN-based rewrites
limitations.example: Query: 'SELECT * FROM table1 UNION SELECT * FROM table2' → May add redundant WHERE clauses or convert to JOIN
limitations.workaround: Use explicit UNION syntax and validate generated query structure

limitations.description: LEFT JOIN with NULL checks may collapse back to INNER JOIN or misapply IS NULL conditions
limitations.example: Query: 'LEFT JOIN ... WHERE right_table.id IS NULL' → May convert to INNER JOIN
limitations.workaround: Provide explicit LEFT JOIN examples in schema context or use subqueries for null filtering

limitations.description: Consistent up to two levels; deeper nesting collapses to simpler branches
limitations.example: Query with 3+ nested CASE WHEN statements → May simplify to 2 levels
limitations.workaround: Break down complex CASE WHEN into multiple queries or use simpler conditional logic

limitations.description: May inject heuristic numeric predicates on aggregate/count prompts
limitations.example: Query: 'Customers with more than 5 orders' → May add filters like 'orders.total > 50000'
limitations.workaround: Provide explicit numeric thresholds in prompt or validate generated query manually

routing._comment: Priority 0.85 for SQL queries. exclude_keywords prevent using expert for explanatory questions.

perf._comment: DoRA r=12 needs 18MB VRAM (vs 15MB for LoRA). Grammar validation adds 0.5ms latency.

runtime._comment: Metadata for Rust/Candle runtime. Qwen3 uses custom flash attention kernel (not standard SDPA).

dataset._comment: Multi-source dataset: 147,140 validated examples (gretelai/synthetic_text_to_sql: 99,935, Clinton/Text-to-sql-v1: 47,145, synthetic_fixes: 60). Additional data sources available: bigcode/the-stack (https://huggingface.co/datasets/bigcode/the-stack/tree/main/data). Multi-dialect normalization (MySQL/SQLite->SQL), sqlglot validation, deduplicated (2,855 removed), English-only. Optimized to text-only format (77% smaller). Checkpoint-1250 achieved 9.6/10 quality score.

config._unsloth_comment: Enable Unsloth for 2x faster training and 70% less VRAM. Requires: pip install 'unsloth[windows] @ git+https://github.com/unslothai/unsloth.git'
config._comment: DoRA r=12, LLaMA-Factory optimized params. Lower LR (5e-5) + higher dropout (0.1) for better generalization.
config._batch_comment: Reduced from 6 to 2 for Windows memory safety. Compensated with gradient_accumulation_steps=45 (effective batch=90).
config._warmup_comment: Using warmup_ratio=0.1 (10%, LLaMA-Factory best practice) = ~150 steps. warmup_steps=0 when using ratio.
config._scheduler_comment: Simple cosine decay. More conservative to prevent pattern overfitting.
config._dataloader_comment: Windows fixes: num_workers=0, pin_memory=false, persistent_workers=false. Prevents worker memory copies and leaks.
config._compile_comment: Windows fix: torch_compile=false (Triton incompatible with PyTorch 2.5.1 on Windows). Unsloth provides enough speedup.
config._cuda_graphs_comment: Windows fix: use_cuda_graphs=false (unstable on Windows). CUDA graphs require torch.compile which leaks memory.

decoding._comment: Unsloth/Qwen recommended settings: temp=0.7, top_p=0.8, top_k=20. Prevents repetition collapse. Grammar validation prevents syntax errors.

checkpoint-1250._comment: Checkpoint-1250 achieved 9.6/10 quality score but regresses to text explanations in some cases. Checkpoint-500 selected for consistent SQL output.

sql_consistency_suite.notes: Melhoria observada frente ao pacote v0.2.1: respostas mais curtas e com menos ruído em JOIN/HAVING/CASE.
